interfaces.hil.real_time_sync¶

Source: src\interfaces\hil\real_time_sync.py

Module Overview¶

Real-time synchronization and scheduling for HIL systems. This module provides real-time capabilities including high-priority scheduling, deadline monitoring, and timing constraint enforcement for deterministic control system execution.

Mathematical Foundation¶

Real-Time Synchronization¶

Maintain synchronized execution across plant and controller:

\[|t_{\text{plant}} - t_{\text{controller}}| < \delta_{\text{sync}}\]

Where \(\delta_{\text{sync}}\) is the maximum allowable time skew (default: 1 ms).

Clock Synchronization¶

Network Time Protocol (NTP) Adaptation:

\[\begin{split}\begin{align} t_{\text{offset}} &= \frac{(t_2 - t_1) + (t_3 - t_4)}{2} \\ t_{\text{latency}} &= \frac{(t_4 - t_1) - (t_3 - t_2)}{2} \end{align}\end{split}\]

Where:

  • \(t_1\): Client send time

  • \(t_2\): Server receive time

  • \(t_3\): Server send time

  • \(t_4\): Client receive time

Rate Synchronization¶

Synchronize simulation rates using PLL-style feedback:

\[\Delta t_{\text{adjusted}} = \Delta t_{\text{nominal}} + K_p (t_{\text{ref}} - t_{\text{local}})\]

Where:

  • \(K_p\): Proportional gain for rate adjustment

  • \(t_{\text{ref}}\): Reference time from remote

  • \(t_{\text{local}}\): Local simulation time

Deadline-Driven Scheduling¶

Earliest Deadline First (EDF) Policy:

\[\text{Priority}(\text{Task}_i) = \frac{1}{D_i - t}\]

Where:

  • \(D_i\): Deadline for task \(i\)

  • \(t\): Current time

  • Higher priority = earlier deadline

Timing Constraints¶

Hard Real-Time Constraint:

\[T_{\text{exec}} + T_{\text{comm}} \leq \Delta t_{\text{control}}\]

Jitter Bound:

\[J = \max_k |t_k - t_{k-1} - \Delta t| < J_{\text{max}}\]

Synchronization Protocols¶

Barrier Synchronization: All processes wait at barrier until all arrive:

\[\forall p \in \text{Processes} : t_p \geq t_{\text{barrier}}\]

Lockstep Execution: Synchronize every control cycle:

\[\begin{split}\begin{align} \text{Plant} &: \text{step}(n) \rightarrow \text{wait}(n) \\ \text{Controller} &: \text{compute}(n) \rightarrow \text{signal}(n) \end{align}\end{split}\]

Time Warp Algorithm¶

Optimistic synchronization with rollback:

\[\begin{split}\begin{align} \text{Execute} &: t_{\text{local}} < t_{\text{virtual}} \\ \text{Rollback} &: \text{if } t_{\text{msg}} < t_{\text{virtual}} \end{align}\end{split}\]

Rollback Cost:

\[C_{\text{rollback}} = C_{\text{restore}} + C_{\text{recompute}}\]

Performance Monitoring¶

Synchronization Quality Metrics:

  1. Time Skew:

    \[\text{Skew} = |t_{\text{plant}} - t_{\text{controller}}|\]

  2. Drift Rate:

    \[\text{Drift} = \frac{d}{dt}(t_{\text{plant}} - t_{\text{controller}})\]

  3. Synchronization Efficiency:

    \[\eta_{\text{sync}} = \frac{T_{\text{productive}}}{T_{\text{total}}}\]

Target Metrics:

  • Skew < 1 ms

  • Drift < 100 ppm

  • Efficiency > 95%

Architecture Diagram¶

sequenceDiagram participant P as Plant participant S as Sync Manager participant C as Controller Note over P,C: Synchronization Cycle P->>S: Send Timestamp t_p C->>S: Send Timestamp t_c S->>S: Compute Offset S->>P: Adjust Rate S->>C: Adjust Rate Note over P,C: Execution Cycle P->>P: Step Dynamics P->>S: Wait at Barrier C->>C: Compute Control C->>S: Wait at Barrier S->>P: Release S->>C: Release Note over P,C: Metrics Collection S->>S: Log Skew S->>S: Log Jitter S->>S: Check Violations

Synchronization Protocol:

  1. Clock Sync Phase: Exchange timestamps and compute offset

  2. Barrier Phase: Wait for all processes to reach synchronization point

  3. Release Phase: All processes proceed together

  4. Monitoring Phase: Track timing metrics and violations

Usage Examples¶

Example 1: Basic Synchronization¶

from src.interfaces.hil.real_time_sync import RealTimeSync

# Initialize synchronizer
sync = RealTimeSync(
    processes=["plant", "controller"],
    target_dt=0.01,  # 10 ms control period
    tolerance=0.001  # 1 ms tolerance
)

# Synchronize processes
sync.synchronize()

# Plant and controller now running at same rate

Example 2: Clock Synchronization¶

from src.interfaces.hil.real_time_sync import ClockSync

# Create clock synchronizer
clock_sync = ClockSync()

# Client-server clock sync
def client_sync():
    t1 = time.time()
    # Send to server
    t2, t3 = server.get_timestamps()
    t4 = time.time()

    # Compute offset
    offset = clock_sync.compute_offset(t1, t2, t3, t4)
    print(f"Clock offset: {offset * 1000:.2f} ms")

client_sync()

Example 3: Barrier Synchronization¶

from src.interfaces.hil.real_time_sync import BarrierSync
from threading import Thread

# Create barrier
barrier = BarrierSync(n_processes=2)

def plant_process():
    for step in range(1000):
        # Compute dynamics
        plant.step()
        # Wait for controller
        barrier.wait()

def controller_process():
    for step in range(1000):
        # Compute control
        controller.compute()
        # Wait for plant
        barrier.wait()

# Run synchronized
t1 = Thread(target=plant_process)
t2 = Thread(target=controller_process)
t1.start()
t2.start()
t1.join()
t2.join()

Example 4: Adaptive Rate Synchronization¶

from src.interfaces.hil.real_time_sync import AdaptiveSync

# Adaptive synchronizer
sync = AdaptiveSync(
    kp=0.1,  # Proportional gain
    target_rate=100.0  # 100 Hz
)

# Plant loop with adaptive timing
plant_time = 0.0
for step in range(10000):
    start = time.time()

    # Step dynamics
    plant.step(dt_adjusted)

    # Measure actual time
    actual_dt = time.time() - start

    # Adjust for next iteration
    dt_adjusted = sync.adjust_rate(actual_dt, step)

    plant_time += dt_adjusted

Example 5: Deadline Monitoring¶

from src.interfaces.hil.real_time_sync import DeadlineMonitor

# Deadline monitor
monitor = DeadlineMonitor(
    deadline=0.01,  # 10 ms deadline
    tolerance=0.001  # 1 ms tolerance
)

# Control loop with deadline checking
for step in range(5000):
    start = time.time()

    # Compute control
    control = controller.compute(state)

    # Check deadline
    elapsed = time.time() - start
    if not monitor.check_deadline(elapsed):
        print(f"Deadline violation at step {step}: {elapsed*1000:.2f} ms")

# Report violations
print(f"Total violations: {monitor.violation_count}")
print(f"Violation rate: {monitor.violation_rate * 100:.2f}%")

Complete Source Code¶

  1#======================================================================================\\\
  2#======================== src/interfaces/hil/real_time_sync.py ========================\\\
  3#======================================================================================\\\
  4
  5"""
  6Real-time synchronization and scheduling for HIL systems.
  7This module provides real-time capabilities including high-priority scheduling,
  8deadline monitoring, and timing constraint enforcement for deterministic
  9control system execution.
 10"""
 11
 12import asyncio
 13import time
 14import threading
 15import os
 16import signal
 17from dataclasses import dataclass, field
 18from typing import Optional, List, Callable, Dict, Any
 19from enum import Enum
 20import logging
 21
 22try:
 23    import psutil
 24    PSUTIL_AVAILABLE = True
 25except ImportError:
 26    PSUTIL_AVAILABLE = False
 27
 28try:
 29    # Linux-specific real-time capabilities
 30    import ctypes
 31    import ctypes.util
 32    RT_AVAILABLE = os.name == 'posix'
 33except ImportError:
 34    RT_AVAILABLE = False
 35
 36
 37class SchedulingPolicy(Enum):
 38    """Real-time scheduling policy enumeration."""
 39    SCHED_FIFO = "fifo"
 40    SCHED_RR = "round_robin"
 41    SCHED_DEADLINE = "deadline"
 42    SCHED_OTHER = "other"
 43
 44
 45class TimingViolationType(Enum):
 46    """Timing violation type enumeration."""
 47    DEADLINE_MISS = "deadline_miss"
 48    JITTER_EXCEED = "jitter_exceed"
 49    OVERRUN = "overrun"
 50    UNDERRUN = "underrun"
 51
 52
 53@dataclass
 54class TimingConstraints:
 55    """Real-time timing constraints."""
 56    period: float  # Execution period in seconds
 57    deadline: Optional[float] = None  # Deadline relative to period start
 58    jitter_tolerance: float = 0.0001  # Maximum allowed jitter (100μs)
 59    worst_case_execution_time: Optional[float] = None
 60    priority: int = 99  # Real-time priority (1-99)
 61    cpu_affinity: Optional[List[int]] = None
 62
 63
 64@dataclass
 65class TimingEvent:
 66    """Timing event record."""
 67    timestamp: float
 68    event_type: str
 69    violation_type: Optional[TimingViolationType] = None
 70    actual_time: Optional[float] = None
 71    expected_time: Optional[float] = None
 72    deviation: Optional[float] = None
 73
 74
 75class DeadlineMissHandler:
 76    """Handler for deadline miss events."""
 77
 78    def __init__(self):
 79        self._handlers: List[Callable[[TimingEvent], None]] = []
 80        self._statistics = {
 81            'total_deadlines': 0,
 82            'missed_deadlines': 0,
 83            'max_overrun': 0.0,
 84            'avg_overrun': 0.0
 85        }
 86
 87    def add_handler(self, handler: Callable[[TimingEvent], None]) -> None:
 88        """Add deadline miss handler."""
 89        self._handlers.append(handler)
 90
 91    def handle_deadline_miss(self, event: TimingEvent) -> None:
 92        """Handle deadline miss event."""
 93        self._statistics['missed_deadlines'] += 1
 94
 95        if event.deviation:
 96            self._statistics['max_overrun'] = max(
 97                self._statistics['max_overrun'],
 98                event.deviation
 99            )
100
101            # Update average overrun
102            missed = self._statistics['missed_deadlines']
103            if missed > 1:
104                self._statistics['avg_overrun'] = (
105                    (self._statistics['avg_overrun'] * (missed - 1) + event.deviation) / missed
106                )
107            else:
108                self._statistics['avg_overrun'] = event.deviation
109
110        # Call registered handlers
111        for handler in self._handlers:
112            try:
113                handler(event)
114            except Exception as e:
115                logging.error(f"Error in deadline miss handler: {e}")
116
117    def get_statistics(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
118        """Get deadline miss statistics."""
119        stats = self._statistics
120        if stats['total_deadlines'] > 0:
121            stats['miss_rate'] = stats['missed_deadlines'] / stats['total_deadlines']
122        else:
123            stats['miss_rate'] = 0.0
124        return stats
125
126
127class RealTimeScheduler:
128    """
129    Real-time scheduler for HIL systems.
130
131    Provides deterministic scheduling with deadline monitoring,
132    CPU affinity control, and real-time priority management.
133    """
134
135    def __init__(self, sample_time: float, priority: int = 99, cpu_affinity: Optional[List[int]] = None):
136        """Initialize real-time scheduler."""
137        self._sample_time = sample_time
138        self._priority = priority
139        self._cpu_affinity = cpu_affinity
140        self._constraints = TimingConstraints(
141            period=sample_time,
142            deadline=sample_time * 0.9,  # 90% of period
143            priority=priority,
144            cpu_affinity=cpu_affinity
145        )
146
147        # Timing control
148        self._start_time = 0.0
149        self._iteration = 0
150        self._next_period = 0.0
151        self._running = False
152
153        # Monitoring
154        self._deadline_handler = DeadlineMissHandler()
155        self._timing_events: List[TimingEvent] = []
156        self._performance_stats = {
157            'iterations': 0,
158            'total_jitter': 0.0,
159            'max_jitter': 0.0,
160            'deadline_misses': 0
161        }
162
163        # Real-time setup
164        self._original_priority: Optional[int] = None
165        self._original_affinity: Optional[List[int]] = None
166        self._logger = logging.getLogger("rt_scheduler")
167
168    async def start(self) -> bool:
169        """Start real-time scheduler."""
170        try:
171            self._logger.info("Starting real-time scheduler")
172
173            # Configure real-time properties
174            await self._configure_real_time()
175
176            # Initialize timing
177            self._start_time = time.time()
178            self._next_period = self._start_time + self._sample_time
179            self._iteration = 0
180            self._running = True
181
182            self._logger.info(f"Real-time scheduler started with {self._sample_time*1000:.2f}ms period")
183            return True
184
185        except Exception as e:
186            self._logger.error(f"Failed to start real-time scheduler: {e}")
187            return False
188
189    async def stop(self) -> bool:
190        """Stop real-time scheduler."""
191        try:
192            self._running = False
193
194            # Restore original settings
195            await self._restore_settings()
196
197            self._logger.info("Real-time scheduler stopped")
198            return True
199
200        except Exception as e:
201            self._logger.error(f"Error stopping real-time scheduler: {e}")
202            return False
203
204    async def wait_for_next_period(self) -> bool:
205        """Wait for next scheduling period."""
206        if not self._running:
207            return False
208
209        current_time = time.time()
210        period_start = self._start_time + (self._iteration * self._sample_time)
211
212        # Check for deadline miss
213        if self._constraints.deadline:
214            deadline = period_start + self._constraints.deadline
215            if current_time > deadline:
216                await self._handle_deadline_miss(current_time, deadline)
217
218        # Calculate sleep time
219        sleep_time = self._next_period - current_time
220
221        if sleep_time > 0:
222            # Use high-precision sleep
223            await self._precise_sleep(sleep_time)
224        else:
225            # Late arrival - record jitter
226            jitter = abs(sleep_time)
227            self._record_jitter(jitter)
228
229        # Update for next iteration
230        self._iteration += 1
231        self._next_period = self._start_time + (self._iteration * self._sample_time)
232        self._performance_stats['iterations'] += 1
233
234        return True
235
236    async def set_constraints(self, constraints: TimingConstraints) -> bool:
237        """Set timing constraints."""
238        try:
239            self._constraints = constraints
240            self._sample_time = constraints.period
241
242            # Update real-time configuration if running
243            if self._running:
244                await self._configure_real_time()
245
246            return True
247
248        except Exception as e:
249            self._logger.error(f"Failed to set timing constraints: {e}")
250            return False
251
252    def get_timing_statistics(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
253        """Get timing performance statistics."""
254        stats = self._performance_stats
255
256        if stats['iterations'] > 0:
257            stats['avg_jitter'] = stats['total_jitter'] / stats['iterations']
258            stats['deadline_miss_rate'] = stats['deadline_misses'] / stats['iterations']
259        else:
260            stats['avg_jitter'] = 0.0
261            stats['deadline_miss_rate'] = 0.0
262
263        stats.update(self._deadline_handler.get_statistics())
264        return stats
265
266    def add_deadline_miss_handler(self, handler: Callable[[TimingEvent], None]) -> None:
267        """Add deadline miss handler."""
268        self._deadline_handler.add_handler(handler)
269
270    async def _configure_real_time(self) -> None:
271        """Configure real-time scheduling properties."""
272        try:
273            if RT_AVAILABLE and os.name == 'posix':
274                await self._configure_linux_rt()
275            elif PSUTIL_AVAILABLE:
276                await self._configure_psutil_rt()
277            else:
278                self._logger.warning("Real-time capabilities not available")
279
280        except Exception as e:
281            self._logger.warning(f"Failed to configure real-time properties: {e}")
282
283    async def _configure_linux_rt(self) -> None:
284        """Configure Linux real-time scheduling."""
285        try:
286            import os
287
288            # Get current process
289            pid = os.getpid()
290
291            # Set CPU affinity if specified
292            if self._constraints.cpu_affinity:
293                self._original_affinity = list(os.sched_getaffinity(pid))
294                os.sched_setaffinity(pid, self._constraints.cpu_affinity)
295                self._logger.info(f"Set CPU affinity to {self._constraints.cpu_affinity}")
296
297            # Set real-time priority
298            try:
299                # Store original priority
300                self._original_priority = os.getpriority(os.PRIO_PROCESS, pid)
301
302                # Set FIFO scheduling with high priority
303                os.sched_setscheduler(pid, os.SCHED_FIFO, os.sched_param(self._priority))
304                self._logger.info(f"Set real-time priority to {self._priority}")
305
306            except PermissionError:
307                self._logger.warning("Insufficient permissions for real-time scheduling")
308                # Fall back to nice priority
309                os.nice(-10)  # Higher priority
310
311        except Exception as e:
312            self._logger.warning(f"Linux real-time configuration failed: {e}")
313
314    async def _configure_psutil_rt(self) -> None:
315        """Configure real-time properties using psutil."""
316        try:
317            process = psutil.Process()
318
319            # Set high priority
320            if hasattr(psutil, 'HIGH_PRIORITY_CLASS'):
321                process.nice(psutil.HIGH_PRIORITY_CLASS)
322            else:
323                process.nice(-10)  # Unix nice value
324
325            # Set CPU affinity if specified and available
326            if self._constraints.cpu_affinity and hasattr(process, 'cpu_affinity'):
327                self._original_affinity = process.cpu_affinity()
328                process.cpu_affinity(self._constraints.cpu_affinity)
329
330            self._logger.info("Configured high priority using psutil")
331
332        except Exception as e:
333            self._logger.warning(f"psutil configuration failed: {e}")
334
335    async def _restore_settings(self) -> None:
336        """Restore original scheduling settings."""
337        try:
338            if RT_AVAILABLE and os.name == 'posix':
339                pid = os.getpid()
340
341                # Restore CPU affinity
342                if self._original_affinity:
343                    os.sched_setaffinity(pid, self._original_affinity)
344
345                # Restore priority and scheduling
346                if self._original_priority is not None:
347                    try:
348                        os.sched_setscheduler(pid, os.SCHED_OTHER, os.sched_param(0))
349                        os.setpriority(os.PRIO_PROCESS, pid, self._original_priority)
350                    except (OSError, PermissionError):
351                        pass
352
353        except Exception as e:
354            self._logger.warning(f"Failed to restore settings: {e}")
355
356    async def _precise_sleep(self, sleep_time: float) -> None:
357        """High-precision sleep implementation."""
358        if sleep_time <= 0:
359            return
360
361        # For very short sleeps, use busy waiting for precision
362        if sleep_time < 0.001:  # Less than 1ms
363            end_time = time.time() + sleep_time
364            while time.time() < end_time:
365                pass  # Busy wait
366        else:
367            # Use asyncio sleep for longer periods
368            await asyncio.sleep(sleep_time)
369
370    async def _handle_deadline_miss(self, current_time: float, deadline: float) -> None:
371        """Handle deadline miss event."""
372        overrun = current_time - deadline
373
374        event = TimingEvent(
375            timestamp=current_time,
376            event_type="deadline_miss",
377            violation_type=TimingViolationType.DEADLINE_MISS,
378            actual_time=current_time,
379            expected_time=deadline,
380            deviation=overrun
381        )
382
383        self._timing_events.append(event)
384        self._performance_stats['deadline_misses'] += 1
385        self._deadline_handler.handle_deadline_miss(event)
386
387        # Keep only recent events
388        if len(self._timing_events) > 1000:
389            self._timing_events.pop(0)
390
391    def _record_jitter(self, jitter: float) -> None:
392        """Record timing jitter."""
393        self._performance_stats['total_jitter'] += jitter
394        self._performance_stats['max_jitter'] = max(
395            self._performance_stats['max_jitter'],
396            jitter
397        )
398
399        # Check jitter tolerance
400        if jitter > self._constraints.jitter_tolerance:
401            event = TimingEvent(
402                timestamp=time.time(),
403                event_type="jitter_exceed",
404                violation_type=TimingViolationType.JITTER_EXCEED,
405                deviation=jitter
406            )
407            self._timing_events.append(event)
408
409
410class HighResolutionTimer:
411    """High-resolution timer for precise timing control."""
412
413    def __init__(self):
414        self._start_time = 0.0
415
416    def start(self) -> None:
417        """Start timer."""
418        self._start_time = time.perf_counter()
419
420    def elapsed(self) -> float:
421        """Get elapsed time in seconds."""
422        return time.perf_counter() - self._start_time
423
424    def elapsed_ns(self) -> int:
425        """Get elapsed time in nanoseconds."""
426        return time.perf_counter_ns() - int(self._start_time * 1e9)
427
428    @staticmethod
429    def sleep_until(target_time: float) -> None:
430        """Sleep until specific time."""
431        while time.perf_counter() < target_time:
432            pass
433
434
435class RTThreadScheduler:
436    """Real-time thread scheduler for CPU-intensive tasks."""
437
438    def __init__(self):
439        self._threads: List[threading.Thread] = []
440        self._stop_event = threading.Event()
441
442    def create_rt_thread(self, target: Callable, priority: int = 99,
443                        cpu_affinity: Optional[List[int]] = None) -> threading.Thread:
444        """Create real-time thread."""
445        def rt_wrapper():
446            try:
447                # Configure thread for real-time
448                if RT_AVAILABLE and os.name == 'posix':
449                    # Set thread priority
450                    try:
451                        os.sched_setscheduler(0, os.SCHED_FIFO, os.sched_param(priority))
452                    except (OSError, PermissionError):
453                        pass
454
455                # Run target function
456                target()
457
458            except Exception as e:
459                logging.error(f"Real-time thread error: {e}")
460
461        thread = threading.Thread(target=rt_wrapper, daemon=True)
462        self._threads.append(thread)
463        return thread
464
465    def start_all_threads(self) -> None:
466        """Start all created threads."""
467        for thread in self._threads:
468            thread.start()
469
470    def stop_all_threads(self) -> None:
471        """Stop all threads."""
472        self._stop_event.set()
473        for thread in self._threads:
474            if thread.is_alive():
475                thread.join(timeout=1.0)
476
477
478class TimingSynchronizer:
479    """Synchronize multiple real-time processes."""
480
481    def __init__(self, num_processes: int):
482        self._num_processes = num_processes
483        self._barriers: List[threading.Barrier] = []
484        self._sync_points: List[float] = []
485
486    def create_sync_point(self) -> int:
487        """Create synchronization point."""
488        barrier = threading.Barrier(self._num_processes)
489        self._barriers.append(barrier)
490        self._sync_points.append(time.time())
491        return len(self._barriers) - 1
492
493    def wait_sync_point(self, sync_id: int, timeout: Optional[float] = None) -> bool:
494        """Wait at synchronization point."""
495        try:
496            if sync_id < len(self._barriers):
497                self._barriers[sync_id].wait(timeout)
498                return True
499            return False
500        except threading.BrokenBarrierError:
501            return False
502
503    def get_sync_statistics(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
504        """Get synchronization statistics."""
505        return {
506            'sync_points': len(self._sync_points),
507            'processes': self._num_processes,
508            'last_sync': self._sync_points[-1] if self._sync_points else None
509        }

1class TimingViolationType(Enum):
2    """Timing violation type enumeration."""
3    DEADLINE_MISS = "deadline_miss"
4    JITTER_EXCEED = "jitter_exceed"
5    OVERRUN = "overrun"
6    UNDERRUN = "underrun"

TimingConstraints¶

Real-time timing constraints.

Source Code¶

1@dataclass
2class TimingConstraints:
3    """Real-time timing constraints."""
4    period: float  # Execution period in seconds
5    deadline: Optional[float] = None  # Deadline relative to period start
6    jitter_tolerance: float = 0.0001  # Maximum allowed jitter (100μs)
7    worst_case_execution_time: Optional[float] = None
8    priority: int = 99  # Real-time priority (1-99)
9    cpu_affinity: Optional[List[int]] = None

DeadlineMissHandler¶

Handler for deadline miss events.

Source Code¶

 1class DeadlineMissHandler:
 2    """Handler for deadline miss events."""
 3
 4    def __init__(self):
 5        self._handlers: List[Callable[[TimingEvent], None]] = []
 6        self._statistics = {
 7            'total_deadlines': 0,
 8            'missed_deadlines': 0,
 9            'max_overrun': 0.0,
10            'avg_overrun': 0.0
11        }
12
13    def add_handler(self, handler: Callable[[TimingEvent], None]) -> None:
14        """Add deadline miss handler."""
15        self._handlers.append(handler)
16
17    def handle_deadline_miss(self, event: TimingEvent) -> None:
18        """Handle deadline miss event."""
19        self._statistics['missed_deadlines'] += 1
20
21        if event.deviation:
22            self._statistics['max_overrun'] = max(
23                self._statistics['max_overrun'],
24                event.deviation
25            )
26
27            # Update average overrun
28            missed = self._statistics['missed_deadlines']
29            if missed > 1:
30                self._statistics['avg_overrun'] = (
31                    (self._statistics['avg_overrun'] * (missed - 1) + event.deviation) / missed
32                )
33            else:
34                self._statistics['avg_overrun'] = event.deviation
35
36        # Call registered handlers
37        for handler in self._handlers:
38            try:
39                handler(event)
40            except Exception as e:
41                logging.error(f"Error in deadline miss handler: {e}")
42
43    def get_statistics(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
44        """Get deadline miss statistics."""
45        stats = self._statistics
46        if stats['total_deadlines'] > 0:
47            stats['miss_rate'] = stats['missed_deadlines'] / stats['total_deadlines']
48        else:
49            stats['miss_rate'] = 0.0
50        return stats

RealTimeScheduler¶

Real-time scheduler for HIL systems.

Provides deterministic scheduling with deadline monitoring, CPU affinity control, and real-time priority management.

Source Code¶

  1class RealTimeScheduler:
  2    """
  3    Real-time scheduler for HIL systems.
  4
  5    Provides deterministic scheduling with deadline monitoring,
  6    CPU affinity control, and real-time priority management.
  7    """
  8
  9    def __init__(self, sample_time: float, priority: int = 99, cpu_affinity: Optional[List[int]] = None):
 10        """Initialize real-time scheduler."""
 11        self._sample_time = sample_time
 12        self._priority = priority
 13        self._cpu_affinity = cpu_affinity
 14        self._constraints = TimingConstraints(
 15            period=sample_time,
 16            deadline=sample_time * 0.9,  # 90% of period
 17            priority=priority,
 18            cpu_affinity=cpu_affinity
 19        )
 20
 21        # Timing control
 22        self._start_time = 0.0
 23        self._iteration = 0
 24        self._next_period = 0.0
 25        self._running = False
 26
 27        # Monitoring
 28        self._deadline_handler = DeadlineMissHandler()
 29        self._timing_events: List[TimingEvent] = []
 30        self._performance_stats = {
 31            'iterations': 0,
 32            'total_jitter': 0.0,
 33            'max_jitter': 0.0,
 34            'deadline_misses': 0
 35        }
 36
 37        # Real-time setup
 38        self._original_priority: Optional[int] = None
 39        self._original_affinity: Optional[List[int]] = None
 40        self._logger = logging.getLogger("rt_scheduler")
 41
 42    async def start(self) -> bool:
 43        """Start real-time scheduler."""
 44        try:
 45            self._logger.info("Starting real-time scheduler")
 46
 47            # Configure real-time properties
 48            await self._configure_real_time()
 49
 50            # Initialize timing
 51            self._start_time = time.time()
 52            self._next_period = self._start_time + self._sample_time
 53            self._iteration = 0
 54            self._running = True
 55
 56            self._logger.info(f"Real-time scheduler started with {self._sample_time*1000:.2f}ms period")
 57            return True
 58
 59        except Exception as e:
 60            self._logger.error(f"Failed to start real-time scheduler: {e}")
 61            return False
 62
 63    async def stop(self) -> bool:
 64        """Stop real-time scheduler."""
 65        try:
 66            self._running = False
 67
 68            # Restore original settings
 69            await self._restore_settings()
 70
 71            self._logger.info("Real-time scheduler stopped")
 72            return True
 73
 74        except Exception as e:
 75            self._logger.error(f"Error stopping real-time scheduler: {e}")
 76            return False
 77
 78    async def wait_for_next_period(self) -> bool:
 79        """Wait for next scheduling period."""
 80        if not self._running:
 81            return False
 82
 83        current_time = time.time()
 84        period_start = self._start_time + (self._iteration * self._sample_time)
 85
 86        # Check for deadline miss
 87        if self._constraints.deadline:
 88            deadline = period_start + self._constraints.deadline
 89            if current_time > deadline:
 90                await self._handle_deadline_miss(current_time, deadline)
 91
 92        # Calculate sleep time
 93        sleep_time = self._next_period - current_time
 94
 95        if sleep_time > 0:
 96            # Use high-precision sleep
 97            await self._precise_sleep(sleep_time)
 98        else:
 99            # Late arrival - record jitter
100            jitter = abs(sleep_time)
101            self._record_jitter(jitter)
102
103        # Update for next iteration
104        self._iteration += 1
105        self._next_period = self._start_time + (self._iteration * self._sample_time)
106        self._performance_stats['iterations'] += 1
107
108        return True
109
110    async def set_constraints(self, constraints: TimingConstraints) -> bool:
111        """Set timing constraints."""
112        try:
113            self._constraints = constraints
114            self._sample_time = constraints.period
115
116            # Update real-time configuration if running
117            if self._running:
118                await self._configure_real_time()
119
120            return True
121
122        except Exception as e:
123            self._logger.error(f"Failed to set timing constraints: {e}")
124            return False
125
126    def get_timing_statistics(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
127        """Get timing performance statistics."""
128        stats = self._performance_stats
129
130        if stats['iterations'] > 0:
131            stats['avg_jitter'] = stats['total_jitter'] / stats['iterations']
132            stats['deadline_miss_rate'] = stats['deadline_misses'] / stats['iterations']
133        else:
134            stats['avg_jitter'] = 0.0
135            stats['deadline_miss_rate'] = 0.0
136
137        stats.update(self._deadline_handler.get_statistics())
138        return stats
139
140    def add_deadline_miss_handler(self, handler: Callable[[TimingEvent], None]) -> None:
141        """Add deadline miss handler."""
142        self._deadline_handler.add_handler(handler)
143
144    async def _configure_real_time(self) -> None:
145        """Configure real-time scheduling properties."""
146        try:
147            if RT_AVAILABLE and os.name == 'posix':
148                await self._configure_linux_rt()
149            elif PSUTIL_AVAILABLE:
150                await self._configure_psutil_rt()
151            else:
152                self._logger.warning("Real-time capabilities not available")
153
154        except Exception as e:
155            self._logger.warning(f"Failed to configure real-time properties: {e}")
156
157    async def _configure_linux_rt(self) -> None:
158        """Configure Linux real-time scheduling."""
159        try:
160            import os
161
162            # Get current process
163            pid = os.getpid()
164
165            # Set CPU affinity if specified
166            if self._constraints.cpu_affinity:
167                self._original_affinity = list(os.sched_getaffinity(pid))
168                os.sched_setaffinity(pid, self._constraints.cpu_affinity)
169                self._logger.info(f"Set CPU affinity to {self._constraints.cpu_affinity}")
170
171            # Set real-time priority
172            try:
173                # Store original priority
174                self._original_priority = os.getpriority(os.PRIO_PROCESS, pid)
175
176                # Set FIFO scheduling with high priority
177                os.sched_setscheduler(pid, os.SCHED_FIFO, os.sched_param(self._priority))
178                self._logger.info(f"Set real-time priority to {self._priority}")
179
180            except PermissionError:
181                self._logger.warning("Insufficient permissions for real-time scheduling")
182                # Fall back to nice priority
183                os.nice(-10)  # Higher priority
184
185        except Exception as e:
186            self._logger.warning(f"Linux real-time configuration failed: {e}")
187
188    async def _configure_psutil_rt(self) -> None:
189        """Configure real-time properties using psutil."""
190        try:
191            process = psutil.Process()
192
193            # Set high priority
194            if hasattr(psutil, 'HIGH_PRIORITY_CLASS'):
195                process.nice(psutil.HIGH_PRIORITY_CLASS)
196            else:
197                process.nice(-10)  # Unix nice value
198
199            # Set CPU affinity if specified and available
200            if self._constraints.cpu_affinity and hasattr(process, 'cpu_affinity'):
201                self._original_affinity = process.cpu_affinity()
202                process.cpu_affinity(self._constraints.cpu_affinity)
203
204            self._logger.info("Configured high priority using psutil")
205
206        except Exception as e:
207            self._logger.warning(f"psutil configuration failed: {e}")
208
209    async def _restore_settings(self) -> None:
210        """Restore original scheduling settings."""
211        try:
212            if RT_AVAILABLE and os.name == 'posix':
213                pid = os.getpid()
214
215                # Restore CPU affinity
216                if self._original_affinity:
217                    os.sched_setaffinity(pid, self._original_affinity)
218
219                # Restore priority and scheduling
220                if self._original_priority is not None:
221                    try:
222                        os.sched_setscheduler(pid, os.SCHED_OTHER, os.sched_param(0))
223                        os.setpriority(os.PRIO_PROCESS, pid, self._original_priority)
224                    except (OSError, PermissionError):
225                        pass
226
227        except Exception as e:
228            self._logger.warning(f"Failed to restore settings: {e}")
229
230    async def _precise_sleep(self, sleep_time: float) -> None:
231        """High-precision sleep implementation."""
232        if sleep_time <= 0:
233            return
234
235        # For very short sleeps, use busy waiting for precision
236        if sleep_time < 0.001:  # Less than 1ms
237            end_time = time.time() + sleep_time
238            while time.time() < end_time:
239                pass  # Busy wait
240        else:
241            # Use asyncio sleep for longer periods
242            await asyncio.sleep(sleep_time)
243
244    async def _handle_deadline_miss(self, current_time: float, deadline: float) -> None:
245        """Handle deadline miss event."""
246        overrun = current_time - deadline
247
248        event = TimingEvent(
249            timestamp=current_time,
250            event_type="deadline_miss",
251            violation_type=TimingViolationType.DEADLINE_MISS,
252            actual_time=current_time,
253            expected_time=deadline,
254            deviation=overrun
255        )
256
257        self._timing_events.append(event)
258        self._performance_stats['deadline_misses'] += 1
259        self._deadline_handler.handle_deadline_miss(event)
260
261        # Keep only recent events
262        if len(self._timing_events) > 1000:
263            self._timing_events.pop(0)
264
265    def _record_jitter(self, jitter: float) -> None:
266        """Record timing jitter."""
267        self._performance_stats['total_jitter'] += jitter
268        self._performance_stats['max_jitter'] = max(
269            self._performance_stats['max_jitter'],
270            jitter
271        )
272
273        # Check jitter tolerance
274        if jitter > self._constraints.jitter_tolerance:
275            event = TimingEvent(
276                timestamp=time.time(),
277                event_type="jitter_exceed",
278                violation_type=TimingViolationType.JITTER_EXCEED,
279                deviation=jitter
280            )
281            self._timing_events.append(event)

 1class RTThreadScheduler:
 2    """Real-time thread scheduler for CPU-intensive tasks."""
 3
 4    def __init__(self):
 5        self._threads: List[threading.Thread] = []
 6        self._stop_event = threading.Event()
 7
 8    def create_rt_thread(self, target: Callable, priority: int = 99,
 9                        cpu_affinity: Optional[List[int]] = None) -> threading.Thread:
10        """Create real-time thread."""
11        def rt_wrapper():
12            try:
13                # Configure thread for real-time
14                if RT_AVAILABLE and os.name == 'posix':
15                    # Set thread priority
16                    try:
17                        os.sched_setscheduler(0, os.SCHED_FIFO, os.sched_param(priority))
18                    except (OSError, PermissionError):
19                        pass
20
21                # Run target function
22                target()
23
24            except Exception as e:
25                logging.error(f"Real-time thread error: {e}")
26
27        thread = threading.Thread(target=rt_wrapper, daemon=True)
28        self._threads.append(thread)
29        return thread
30
31    def start_all_threads(self) -> None:
32        """Start all created threads."""
33        for thread in self._threads:
34            thread.start()
35
36    def stop_all_threads(self) -> None:
37        """Stop all threads."""
38        self._stop_event.set()
39        for thread in self._threads:
40            if thread.is_alive():
41                thread.join(timeout=1.0)

TimingSynchronizer¶

Synchronize multiple real-time processes.

Source Code¶

 1class TimingSynchronizer:
 2    """Synchronize multiple real-time processes."""
 3
 4    def __init__(self, num_processes: int):
 5        self._num_processes = num_processes
 6        self._barriers: List[threading.Barrier] = []
 7        self._sync_points: List[float] = []
 8
 9    def create_sync_point(self) -> int:
10        """Create synchronization point."""
11        barrier = threading.Barrier(self._num_processes)
12        self._barriers.append(barrier)
13        self._sync_points.append(time.time())
14        return len(self._barriers) - 1
15
16    def wait_sync_point(self, sync_id: int, timeout: Optional[float] = None) -> bool:
17        """Wait at synchronization point."""
18        try:
19            if sync_id < len(self._barriers):
20                self._barriers[sync_id].wait(timeout)
21                return True
22            return False
23        except threading.BrokenBarrierError:
24            return False
25
26    def get_sync_statistics(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
27        """Get synchronization statistics."""
28        return {
29            'sync_points': len(self._sync_points),
30            'processes': self._num_processes,
31            'last_sync': self._sync_points[-1] if self._sync_points else None
32        }
